tweets.text: @implausible17 @rstats_tweets I see people saying you can use Python in RStudio which is true. This might just be me here but it was not intuitive to start with and I am much happier switching between IDE’s rather than trying to use reticulate all the time (although reticulate is awesome and I do use it)

@implausible17 @rstats_tweets I too am from an R background but have just started using a Python more. Spyder is the IDE that is most like RStudio but I really like VSCode! This might be because I use R and Python for different things and so have different needs.

Python is growing on me as a language - but I still prefer RStudio as IDE -can anyone who uses both recommend a nice Python IDE?  In particular one that autosuggests variable names etc as well as RStudio does?  & which makes it as easy to eyeball/search/filter dataframes? #Rstats

urls.title: Daily News: R-devel/NEWS
urls.description: As an experimental feature the placeholder ‘_’ can now also be used in the ‘rhs’ of a forward pipe ‘| >’ expression as the first argument in an extraction call, such as ‘_$coef’. More generally, it can be used as the head of a chain of extractions, such as ‘_$coef[[2]]’. ‘Rd2txt()’ now preserves line breaks of \verb Rd content. This also fixes the rendering of verbatim output from Rd \Sexpr in plain-text

You can join our Slack group here: https://t.co/vODDzqaBCm https://t.co/SzeJJ8PD6D

urls.title: Psych #rstats Interest Form
urls.description: Hello everyone! We've observed that many beginners struggle to understand the statistics in Psychology research papers and learning R. We're planning to come up with a platform to help beginners navigate statistics in research papers and learning R. This would be peer-to- peer collaborative learning and would be absolutely free of cost. With this form we wish to know the current gaps, struggles and areas we can focus on. Please fill this form to express your interest in joining such an initiative. More information to come soon. Please spread the word! If you've any queries please reach out to us at psych.rstats.club@gmail.com .

urls.title: 2023 Webinar Series - Analyzing 2017-2021 ACS Data using R and Python - A Webinar Series for Teachers and Researchers | Social Science Data Analysis Network
urls.description: 2023's webinar series is called Analyzing 2017-2021 ACS Data in R and Python. These webinars will be led by Kyle Walker, Associate Professor at Texas Christian University and R developer. During three free virtual workshops, participants will learn how to use R to analyze census data for use in courses and research in sociology, economics, public policy, urban studies and related disciplines. Participants are welcome to join one or all three webinars.
